bibl.title: The Reuse of Christian Texts: P. Macquarie Inv. 360 + P. Migl. Vogl. Inv. 1224 (P 91) and P. Oxy. X 1229 (P 23).

series.title: Texts and Editions for New Testament Study.

bibl.note: P. Macquarie Inv. 360 + P. Mil. Vogl. Inv. 1224 (= LDAB 2851): fold marks; - dimensions of the leaf; - the written area; - the page size; - the original position of the fragments. - P. Oxy. X, 1229 (= van Haelst 543; LDAB 2770): original size; - fold marks. - P. Oxy. III, 407 (= van Haelst 952; LDAB 5531).

bibl.title: Early Christian Manuscripts. Examples of Applied Method and Research.

bibl.seg: Barker Don, The Reuse of Christian Texts: P. Macquarie Inv. 360 + P. Migl. Vogl. Inv. 1224 (P 91) and P. Oxy. X 1229 (P 23).

Thomas J. Kraus and Tobias Nicklas (Edd.), Early Christian Manuscripts. Examples of Applied Method and Research = Texts and Editions for New Testament Study. 5 (Leiden, 2010) pp. 129-143, 3 tabl. et 8 figg.

P. Macquarie Inv. 360 + P. Mil. Vogl. Inv. 1224 (= LDAB 2851): fold marks; - dimensions of the leaf; - the written area; - the page size; - the original position of the fragments. - P. Oxy. X, 1229 (= van Haelst 543; LDAB 2770): original size; - fold marks. - P. Oxy. III, 407 (= van Haelst 952; LDAB 5531).
